column5: That's what the Canadians told me also. Thanks for the link and the help. They are loaded , gassed and ready to head north !!!!!
Can anyone tell me if I need anything special to bring sleds to Ontario ? We will not be doing any trail riding , just some ice fishing . They are registered of course. Thanks
You don't need anything special. Good luck fishing!
Thanks ..... I am excited to say the least !!!!
Where are you heading to....and when?
Need reg. & insurance cards. Be careful don't get a bug to go on the trails without a permit. The fines are hefty
Sturgeon Lake next Saturday. What do the consider "trails" ?
They have, in my opinion, the most advanced & best trail system for snowmobiling that I have ever seen or had the pleasure of riding on.

Perhaps someone like V Bay can confirm, but I think as long as you are just fishing and have fishing equipment, you can travel to and from the lakes using any trail without a permit. That Is what I recall for residents, I am not sure about non resident. It's worth asking about.
if you are riding on a marked trail you need a permit.

Check under e-laws Ontario regulation 185/01 13. (a) Licensed anglers. While engaged in angling activities during open season, as defined in the Ontario Fishery Regulations made under the Fisheries Act (Canada), pursuant to a valid fishing or fishing/hunting outdoors card and a valid sport fishing validation tag, both issued under the Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act, 1997, and while travelling on Crown or other public land directly to or from the area open for angling, within the meaning of the Fisheries Act (Canada), if the trail is the only access route from the closest road to the area open for angling or is the only safe access route to the area open for angling. No trail permit required under these conditions..
